content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm is a set of four whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score A are: D4, F4, A4, and C4.

Score B has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm is a set of four whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score B are: D4, F4, A4, and C sharp 4.

Score C has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm is a set of four whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score C are: D4, F sharp 4, A4, and C4.

Score D has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm is a set of four whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score D are: D4, F sharp 4, A4, and C sharp 4.

content.answer: Score C has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm is a set of four whole notes played in succession. The pitches in score C are: D4, F sharp 4, A4, and C4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
